result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
25 hours community service
Groups/day report at level determined by case manager. 
Complete AODA and Mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in other community based services as directed by the VIP program director.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah L. Fiebiger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mariah L. Fiebiger in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:43 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:   Count 1 - NO CONTEST
 
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court does not find the defendant guilty due to the VIP program request.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Placed in the VIP program for a period of 1 year: 
25 hours community service
Groups/day report at level determined by case manager. 
Complete AODA and Mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in other community based services as directed by the VIP program director.

records.addlTxt:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Mariah L. Fiebiger in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
